DBType: Database engine used. Currently, only MySQL is supported
DBPrefix: Prefix used for database tables names
DBHost: Denotes hostname or socket path used for connecting to SQL database
DBName: The name of database in SQL server used
UseSlaveConnection: Set of parameters for separate read/write access to the database. If set to true, the first set of credentials will be used to write to the database while Slave credentials - to read from it
DBSlaveHost: Slave database hostname or socket path
DBLogQueryParams: If enabled, parameters values will be recorded in the logs
DBDebugBacktraceLimit: This parameter can be used to limit the number of stack frames returned
LoggingLevel: For debug logs, verbosity level can be set to Full, Warning or Error
LogCustomFullPath: Allows for overriding log files location
LogPostView: Determines whether to log full POST data or just key names
AllowThumbnail: If disabled, image thumbnails will not be generated
ThumbnailMaxFileSizeMb: Denotes a max filesize of images thumbnails are generated for, in Mbytes
CacheCtrl: If true, content of mail message opened in a new browser tab will be retrieved from cache
DisplayServerErrorInformation: If enabled, error messages will include texts returned from the server
RedirectToHttps: If enabled, users will automatically be redirected from HTTP to HTTPS
SocketConnectTimeoutSeconds: Socket connection timeout limit, in seconds
SocketGetTimeoutSeconds: Socket stream access timeout, in seconds
UseAppMinJs: Enables loading minified JS files (default behavior)
XFrameOptions: If set to SAMEORIGIN, disallows embedding product interface into IFrame to prevent from clickjacking attacks
RemoveOldLogs: If enabled, logs older than RemoveOldLogsDays days are automatically removed
RemoveOldLogsDays: Value for use with RemoveOldLogs setting
LogStackTrace: If enabled, logs will contain full stack trace of exceptions; disabled by default to prevent logs from containing sensitive data
ExpireUserSessionsBeforeTimestamp: If set, all user sessions prior to this timestamp will be considered expired
PasswordMinLength: Used by password change modules, if set to non-zero, denotes minimal length of new password
PasswordMustBeComplex: Used by password change modules, if set to true, new password has to include at least one digit and at least one non-alphanumeric character
StoreAuthTokenInDB: If enabled, authentication tokens will be stored in the database and can be revoked
AuthTokenExpirationLifetimeDays: If set to non-zero value, means auth tokens will expire after this number of days. 0 means the feature is disabled.
